title: Need font close to Klavika
content: I need something that is close (in apperance and tone) to Klavika. I know it is a bit of a wierd request, but does anyone have any good suggestions?
author: Hildebrant

comments.content:
Nothing weird about the request. This is one of the better ways to font search.

Check out the fonts mentioned in this [Typographica article on Klavika](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223155939/http:/typographica.org/2004/on-typography/squarish-klavika-almost-didnt-happen/).

Others that might interest you:

[Cachet](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223155939/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/cachet_std_vp/?affid=99346) and its weaker sequel, [Zemestro](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223155939/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/zemestro_std_vp/?affid=99346)  
 [Neo Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223155939/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/neo_sans_std_vp/?affid=99346)

\> a wierd request

It's fine, since you didn't append "free or real cheap"... :-/

hhp

Maybe Katarine by Suitcase Type Foundry? [http://www.suitcasetype.com/page.php?lmut=en&section=font&font=katarine&...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223155939/http:/www.suitcasetype.com/page.php?lmut=en&section=font&font=katarine&font_section=text "http://www.suitcasetype.com/page.php?lmut=en&section=font&font=katarine&font\_section=text")

Some great suggestions here -- thanks guys (and gal).

Cheers!
